orestes.bloomfilter.redis

Class BloomFilterRedis<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • orestes.bloomfilter.BloomFilter<T>
      • orestes.bloomfilter.redis.BloomFilterRedis<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class BloomFilterRedis<T>
extends BloomFilter<T>
    A persistent bloom filter backed by the Redis key value store. Internally it operates on the setbit and getbit operations of Redis. If you need to remove elements from the bloom filter, please use a counting bloom filter, e.g. CBloomFilterRedis. The performance of this data structure is very good, as operations are grouped into fast transactions, minimizing the network overhead of all bloom filter operations to one round trip to Redis.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setHashMethod

        public void setHashMethod(BloomFilter.HashMethod hashMethod)
        Description copied from class: BloomFilter
        Sets the method used to generate hash values. Note that all previously inserted elements become invalid if you change this setting and the bloom filter should be reset using BloomFilter.clear() before being used again. Possible hash methods are:
        • HashMethod.Cryptographic is the default. It uses a cryptographic hash function (e.g. MD5, SHA-512, default is MD5) which can be set using BloomFilter.setCryptographicHashFunction(String). It slices the digest in bit ranges of x with 2^x > m and does rejection sampling for each slice. It is fast and very well distributed.
        • HashMethod.RNG uses the random number generator of Java, which is a Linear Congruent Generator (LCG). It is very fast but doesn't distribute hash values very uniformly.
        • HashMethod.SecureRNG uses the secure random number generator of Java, which satisfies a high degree of randomness at the cost of CPU time.
        • HashMethod.CarterWegman implements the Carter Wegman Universal Hashing Function. It has very good theoretical guarantees for the uniform distribution of hash values but can be ~10 times slower than other methods, as it has to perform arithmetic operations on potentially large numbers.
        • HashMethod.CRC32 uses a CRC32 checksum. It is rather fast an offers a good distribution.
        • HashMethod.Adler32 uses the Adler32 checksum. Adler32 is faster than CRC32 but offers a slightly less uniform distribution.
        • HashMethod.Murmur uses the Murmur 2 hash function. It is a new and increasingly popular hash function that is fast and very uniformly distributed.
        Overrides:
        setHashMethod in class BloomFilter<T>
        Parameters:
        hashMethod - the method used to generate hash values

      • setCryptographicHashFunction

        public void setCryptographicHashFunction(java.lang.String hashFunctionName)
        Description copied from class: BloomFilter
        Uses the given cryptographic hash function. Note that all previously inserted elements become invalid and the bloom filter should be reset using BloomFilter.clear() before being used again.
        Overrides:
        setCryptographicHashFunction in class BloomFilter<T>
        Parameters:
        hashFunctionName - name of the hash function to be used, i.e. MD2, MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-384 or SHA-512

      • add

        public boolean add(byte[] value)
        Description copied from class: BloomFilter
        Add the passed value to the filter.
        Overrides:
        add in class BloomFilter<T>
        Parameters:
        value - key to add
        Returns:
        true if the value does not exist in the filter. Note a false positive may occur, thus the value may not have already been in the filter, but it hashed to a set of bits already in the filter
